result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are Concurrent with each other and also Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co cases 13CF773 and 15CF371, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment or undergo a course of education or a combination of both - def to work with PO
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with J.B. without approval of PO
.

Participate in Cognitive Intervention as determined by the PO

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 13CF773

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to complete 5 hours of community service work each week - after 6 months the PO can determine if this should continue

Both Counts are concurrent with each other & also with 13CF773 & 15CF371 (one-time only)
.
Concurrent with: 13CF773 & 15CF371
.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is to remain in custody until 5-9-16 at 10:00 a.m. and then can be released to serve the balance of the sentence on Electronic Monitoring with House Arrest through Justice Support Services

Justice Support Services to get the defendant set up on the monitor since def will be living outside the county

Unpaid Court financial obligations will be converted to a Civil Judgment
.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 1 of this case
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Johnston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Unpaid financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment - signed by SLH
from PO Hines   re: Sentencing after Revocation / Rev Summary filed

3:00 PM  - Def in court w/ Atty Patricia Linda O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HYNEK: recommendations by DOC are approp. O'NEIL: He has a daughter and the mom said that she was breaking up w/ him. He has a place to go when released into the community. His plan is to get away from drugs, get his HSED. His mom actually introduced him to meth. CRT: you substitute 2 wks of freedom f/ 2.5 mos confinement w/o release and that's a very short sighted decision on your part. I accept your atty's stmt that after a period of absconding you turned yourself in
SENTENCE: def sentenced to 8 mos CJ w/ credit for 167 days. Remain in custody untl 5/9 @ 10 AM and the balance can be on EM on house arrest-  JSS can get you set up on the monitor since you will be living outside the county.  financials converted to civil judgment
ejss

State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Zach Leigh
Motion for Consolidation w/ 15CF371, 15CM204, 15CM585 & 15CM657 - Order consolidating cases in Br 4 signed by SLH
Stmt of Neg Plea /  Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Cts 1 & 3 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT finds def's plea is FV&I made - factual basis exists to accept plea & finds def guilty
Remaining Cts are Dismissed & read-in
State is in compliance w/ Victim Rights - Hynek gives recommendation / Leigh comments
CRT:  there was a COMPAS filed in 15CM657 - has all parties seen it?
Hynek: has not seen it but will not change my recommendation
CRT prints copy of COMPAS for parties
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs Concurrent w/ 13CF773 & 15CF371, w/ conditions also concurrent:  No Contact w/ J.B. w/o approval of PO;  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or cont subs w/ random testing;  Complete 5 hrs of Comm Serv. work each week, after 6 mos PO can determine if this should continue (concurrent w/ 13CF773 & 15CF371);  Pay restitution & surcharge as shown in 13CF773;  Participate in Cognitive Intervention as determined by PO;  Obtain & maintain employment or undergo course of education or combination of both - def to work w/ PO;  Pay CC & DOC fees

Def in custody w/Atty Terrien & Zachar
$2500 cash bond req (all files) w/cond: no contact w/JB, no CS w/o Rx, comply w/JS w/testing, GPS house arrest, submit to DNA testing

State by Gruenke,.
Defendant in custody with Zachar for Wright.
Copy of complaint/waived reading.
NG plea entered.
PTC 6-19-15 at 3:30 pm
